DELETE /accounts/{account_id}/devices/se.description: Resets the current device settings for a Zero Trust account.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful.

disable_for_time.description: Sets the time limit, in seconds, that a user can use an override code to bypass WARP.

external_emergency_signal_enabled.description: Controls whether the external emergency disconnect feature is enabled.

external_emergency_signal_fingerprint.description: The SHA256 fingerprint (64 hexadecimal characters) of the HTTPS server certificate for the external_emergency_signal_url. If provided, the WARP client will use this value to verify the server's identity. The device will ignore any response if the server's certificate fingerprint does not exactly match this value.

external_emergency_signal_interval.description: The interval at which the WARP client fetches the emergency disconnect signal, formatted as a duration string (e.g., "5m", "2m30s", "1h"). Minimum 30 seconds.

external_emergency_signal_url.description: The HTTPS URL from which to fetch the emergency disconnect signal. Must use HTTPS and have an IPv4 or IPv6 address as the host.

gateway_proxy_enabled.description: Enable gateway proxy filtering on TCP.

gateway_udp_proxy_enabled.description: Enable gateway proxy filtering on UDP.

root_certificate_installation_enabled.description: Enable installation of cloudflare managed root certificate.

200.description: Reset response for device settings for a Zero Trust account.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful.

disable_for_time.description: Sets the time limit, in seconds, that a user can use an override code to bypass WARP.

external_emergency_signal_enabled.description: Controls whether the external emergency disconnect feature is enabled.

external_emergency_signal_fingerprint.description: The SHA256 fingerprint (64 hexadecimal characters) of the HTTPS server certificate for the external_emergency_signal_url. If provided, the WARP client will use this value to verify the server's identity. The device will ignore any response if the server's certificate fingerprint does not exactly match this value.

external_emergency_signal_url.description: The HTTPS URL from which to fetch the emergency disconnect signal. Must use HTTPS and have an IPv4 or IPv6 address as the host.

gateway_proxy_enabled.description: Enable gateway proxy filtering on TCP.

gateway_udp_proxy_enabled.description: Enable gateway proxy filtering on UDP.

root_certificate_installation_enabled.description: Enable installation of cloudflare managed root certificate.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful.

4XX.description: Reset failure response device settings for a Zero Trust account.

DELETE /accounts/{account_id}/devices/se.summary: Reset device settings for a Zero Trust account with defaults. This turns off all proxying.

success.description: Indicate whether the API call was successful.

id.description: Specify the Cloudflare account ID.

success.description: Indicate whether the API call was successful.

id.description: Specify the Cloudflare account ID.

success.description: Indicate whether the API call was successful.

GET /accounts/{account_id}/gateway/confi.description: Retrieve the current Zero Trust account configuration.

success.description: Indicate whether the API call was successful.

enabled.description: Specify whether to log activity.

enabled_download_phase.description: Specify whether to enable anti-virus scanning on downloads.

enabled_upload_phase.description: Specify whether to enable anti-virus scanning on uploads.

fail_closed.description: Specify whether to block requests for unscannable files.

notification_settings.description: Configure the message the user's device shows during an antivirus scan.

enabled.description: Specify whether to enable notifications.

include_context.description: Specify whether to include context information as query parameters.

msg.description: Specify the message to show in the notification.

support_url.description: Specify a URL that directs users to more information. If unset, the notification opens a block page.

background_color.description: Specify the block page background color in `#rrggbb` format when the mode is customized_block_page.

enabled.description: Specify whether to enable the custom block page.

footer_text.description: Specify the block page footer text when the mode is customized_block_page.

header_text.description: Specify the block page header text when the mode is customized_block_page.

include_context.description: Specify whether to append context to target_uri as query parameters. This applies only when the mode is redirect_uri.

logo_path.description: Specify the full URL to the logo file when the mode is customized_block_page.

mailto_address.description: Specify the admin email for users to contact when the mode is customized_block_page.

mailto_subject.description: Specify the subject line for emails created from the block page when the mode is customized_block_page.

mode.description: Specify whether to redirect users to a Cloudflare-hosted block page or a customer-provided URI.

name.description: Specify the block page title when the mode is customized_block_page.

read_only.description: Indicate that this setting was shared via the Orgs API and read only for the current account.

source_account.description: Indicate the account tag of the account that shared this setting.

suppress_footer.description: Specify whether to suppress detailed information at the bottom of the block page when the mode is customized_block_page.

target_uri.description: Specify the URI to redirect users to when the mode is redirect_uri.

version.description: Indicate the version number of the setting.

inspection_mode.description: Specify the inspection mode as either `deep` or `shallow`.

non_identity_enabled.description: Specify whether to enable non-identity onramp support for Browser Isolation.

url_browser_isolation_enabled.description: Specify whether to enable Clientless Browser Isolation.

certificate.description: Specify certificate settings for Gateway TLS interception. If unset, the Cloudflare Root CA handles interception.

id.description: Specify the UUID of the certificate used for interception. Ensure the certificate is available at the edge(previously called 'active'). A nil UUID directs Cloudflare to use the Root CA.

custom_certificate.description: Specify custom certificate settings for BYO-PKI. This field is deprecated; use `certificate` instead.

enabled.description: Specify whether to enable a custom certificate authority for signing Gateway traffic.

id.description: Specify the UUID of the certificate (ID from MTLS certificate store).

extended_email_matching.description: Configures user email settings for firewall policies. When you enable this, the system standardizes email addresses in the identity portion of the rule to match extended email variants in firewall policies. When you disable this setting, the system matches email addresses exactly as you provide them. Enable this setting if your email uses `.` or `+` modifiers.

enabled.description: Specify whether to match all variants of user emails (with + or . modifiers) used as criteria in Firewall policies.

read_only.description: Indicate that this setting was shared via the Orgs API and read only for the current account.

source_account.description: Indicate the account tag of the account that shared this setting.

version.description: Indicate the version number of the setting.

tls.description: Enforce cipher suites and TLS versions compliant with FIPS 140-2.

host_selector.description: Enable host selection in egress policies.

enabled.description: Specify whether to enable filtering via hosts for egress policies.

mode.description: Define the proxy inspection mode.   1. static: Gateway applies static inspection to HTTP on TCP(80). With TLS decryption on, Gateway inspects HTTPS traffic on TCP(443) and UDP(443).   2. dynamic: Gateway applies protocol detection to inspect HTTP and HTTPS traffic on any port. TLS decryption must remain on to inspect HTTPS traffic.

protocol_detection.description: Specify whether to detect protocols from the initial bytes of client traffic.

enabled.description: Specify whether to detect protocols from the initial bytes of client traffic.

sandbox.description: Specify whether to enable the sandbox.

enabled.description: Specify whether to enable the sandbox.

fallback_action.description: Specify the action to take when the system cannot scan the file.

tls_decrypt.description: Specify whether to inspect encrypted HTTP traffic.

enabled.description: Specify whether to inspect encrypted HTTP traffic.

success.description: Indicate whether the API call was successful.

redact_pii.description: Indicate whether to redact personally identifiable information from activity logging (PII fields include source IP, user email, user ID, device ID, URL, referrer, and user agent).

settings_by_rule_type.description: Configure logging settings for each rule type.

log_all.description: Specify whether to log all requests to this service.

log_blocks.description: Specify whether to log only blocking requests to this service.

dns.description: Configure logging settings for DNS firewall.

PATCH /accounts/{account_id}/gateway/con.description: Update (PATCH) a single subcollection of settings such as `antivirus`, `tls_decrypt`, `activity_log`, `block_page`, `browser_isolation`, `fips`, `body_scanning`, or `certificate` without updating the entire configuration object. This endpoint returns an error if any settings collection lacks proper configuration.

enabled.description: Specify whether to match all variants of user emails (with + or . modifiers) used as criteria in Firewall policies.

read_only.description: Indicate that this setting was shared via the Orgs API and read only for the current account.

source_account.description: Indicate the account tag of the account that shared this setting.

version.description: Indicate the version number of the setting.

tls.description: Enforce cipher suites and TLS versions compliant with FIPS 140-2.

host_selector.description: Enable host selection in egress policies.

enabled.description: Specify whether to enable filtering via hosts for egress policies.

mode.description: Define the proxy inspection mode.   1. static: Gateway applies static inspection to HTTP on TCP(80). With TLS decryption on, Gateway inspects HTTPS traffic on TCP(443) and UDP(443).   2. dynamic: Gateway applies protocol detection to inspect HTTP and HTTPS traffic on any port. TLS decryption must remain on to inspect HTTPS traffic.

POST /accounts/{account_id}/gateway.description: Create a Zero Trust account for an existing Cloudflare account.

PUT /accounts/{account_id}/devices/setti.description: Updates the current device settings for a Zero Trust account.

disable_for_time.description: Sets the time limit, in seconds, that a user can use an override code to bypass WARP.

external_emergency_signal_enabled.description: Controls whether the external emergency disconnect feature is enabled.

external_emergency_signal_fingerprint.description: The SHA256 fingerprint (64 hexadecimal characters) of the HTTPS server certificate for the external_emergency_signal_url. If provided, the WARP client will use this value to verify the server's identity. The device will ignore any response if the server's certificate fingerprint does not exactly match this value.

external_emergency_signal_interval.description: The interval at which the WARP client fetches the emergency disconnect signal, formatted as a duration string (e.g., "5m", "2m30s", "1h"). Minimum 30 seconds.

external_emergency_signal_url.description: The HTTPS URL from which to fetch the emergency disconnect signal. Must use HTTPS and have an IPv4 or IPv6 address as the host.

gateway_proxy_enabled.description: Enable gateway proxy filtering on TCP.

gateway_udp_proxy_enabled.description: Enable gateway proxy filtering on UDP.

root_certificate_installation_enabled.description: Enable installation of cloudflare managed root certificate.

external_emergency_signal_enabled.description: Controls whether the external emergency disconnect feature is enabled.

If provided, the WARP client will use this value to verify the server's identity. The device will ignore any response if the server's certificate fingerprint does not exactly match this value.

external_emergency_signal_url.description: The HTTPS URL from which to fetch the emergency disconnect signal. Must use HTTPS and have an IPv4 or IPv6 address as the host.

gateway_proxy_enabled.description: Enable gateway proxy filtering on TCP.

gateway_udp_proxy_enabled.description: Enable gateway proxy filtering on UDP.

root_certificate_installation_enabled.description: Enable installation of cloudflare managed root certificate.

PUT /accounts/{account_id}/gateway/loggi.description: Update logging settings for the current Zero Trust account.

redact_pii.description: Indicate whether to redact personally identifiable information from activity logging (PII fields include source IP, user email, user ID, device ID, URL, referrer, and user agent).

settings_by_rule_type.description: Configure logging settings for each rule type.

log_blocks.description: Specify whether to log only blocking requests to this service.
